DOC.HEAD: Victim's Father Suffers Heart Attack After Learning of Slaying
LaserPhoto LA2
DOC.TEXT: Friends have mourned a young immigrant who was abducted during a drive-in movie date and then raped and slain, and donors are paying to return her body to her homeland. The Rev. Luis Valbuena addressed more than 1,000 parishioners Sunday at Holy Family parish in Wilmington, where 20-year-old Irene Franco often prayed. ``How can we have tragic incidents like the case of Irene in our midst? It's not human,'' the Roman Catholic priest said. ``But even animals kill only in self-defense or because they have to eat. They don't kill like this.'' There had been no arrests as of Monday in what authorities said was an apparently random attack. There was no sign that drugs or gangs were involved, said Los Angeles County sheriff's Detective Joe Barnes. Valbuena said Ms. Franco's father, Roberto Franco, suffered a mild heart attack after learning about her death. Franco had planned to oversee the return of his daughter's body to Guadalajara, Mexico, Valbuena said. The priest said anonymous donors contributed money to pay for the return of Ms. Franco's body. A funeral home in Guadalajara planned to pay the cost of burial, Valbuena said. Authorities said Ms. Franco, who had been living in nearby Wilmington for about a year, was watching a drive-in movie with her boyfriend, Jesus Martinez, when they were kidnapped at gunpoint Friday. Martinez, 26, a Gardena construction worker, told authorities that three men commandeered their car at gunpoint, tied them up and drove them to an alley, where they took turns beating Martinez with a board and beating and raping Ms. Franco. Martinez called authorities from a pay telephone after the men drove off with Ms. Franco. Before leaving, they shouted something like, ``Don't worry about your girlfriend. we'll drop her off in a few minutes,'' sheriff's Deputy Dean Scoville said. A 13-year-old boy found Ms. Franco's body Saturday morning several miles from the drive-in in Carson, 17 miles south of Los Angeles. She had been shot in the head. The couple's car was found burned near Watts.
